description: Number of base n digits required to write n!.
links: Harry J. Smith and Danny Rorabaugh, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (first 1000 terms by Harry J. Smith)
formula: a(n) = 1 + floor(log(n!)/log(n)) = 1 + A039960(n) for n>1.From _Danny Rorabaugh_, Apr 14 2015: (Start)a(n) = 1 + log_n(A074182(n)) for n>1.a(n) = A074184(n) = log_n(A074181(n)) for n>2.(End)
example: a(6)=4 since 6!=720, which in base 6 is 3200.
prog: (PARI) { default(realprecision, 10); for (n=1, 1000, if (n==1, a=1, a=1 + floor(log(n!)/log(n))); write("b060151.txt", n, " ", a); ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 02 2009(Sage) [1] + [1 + floor(log(factorial(n))/log(n)) for n in range(2,74)] # _Danny Rorabaugh_, Apr 14 2015(MAGMA) [1] cat [1 + Floor(Log(Factorial(n))/Log(n)): n in [2..80]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Apr 15 2015
crossrefs: Cf. A011776 for number of final zeros of n! written in base n.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 08 2001
